alert.note: Alert for Grundy; La Salle; Livingston (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 21 at 9:50PM CST until January 23 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM MONDAY TO 6 AM CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of up to one inch and ice accumulations of one tenth to two tenths of an inch. * WHERE...La Salle, Grundy and Livingston Counties. * WHEN...From 5 AM Monday to 6 AM CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The first round of precipitation will begin as a light snow and sleet mix early Monday morning, then will transition to a period of freezing drizzle in the afternoon. A second more impactful period of precipitation is expected Monday night. This will fall mainly in the form of freezing rain. While air temperatures will be warming to near freezing during the period of rainfall late Monday night, subfreezing ground temperatures will continue to make for icy and very slick streets and sidewalks into early Tuesday morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Illinois can be obtained on the internet at www.gettingaroundillinois.com.
